Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Corinthian black-figured pottery kylix; interior: glazed black (only traces remaining) with possible band in added red; exterior: black-figure frieze; on left, part of the hind leg of a hoofed animal to left; right hind leg, part of rump, tail and left hind leg of feline to right; below, two bands above tops of two rays.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.081) (Phase 1)
